w.t: : (place to offer to the spirits) igi-tabo
: (to be) ku-babara, kw-ijirwa, gu-shavura, gu-tuntura, gu-shangashirwa
: (native crude, made by soaking ashes of a certain plant) umu-gonzo
: (to give salt to domestic animals) kw-uhira
: (to be for a year, beans) gu-hitira
: (to be for several years, beans) gu-hitikirana, gu-hitirana
: (something that's been saved up for a year) igi-hitira
: (one who says things he shouldn't when with others) iki-randamuke
: (left by person scratching or biting another) in-kogote
: (seeds or dirt by scratching as chicken does) gu-sura
: (spit spurted from between teeth as indication of) iny-eri
: (feet on floor, esp. because of itching) gu-syegenya
: (carefully to see if anyone is there) gu-kenguza
: (one who likes to go by himself rather than with others) iki-rarashamba
: (to plan to do something s.) kw-imbirira
: (to give as pledge or security) ku-gwatiriza
: (that someone wishes to see you alone) gu-kebuka
: (s. one indistinctly because he went too fast) rurabge
: (doer of evil, as witch doctor does) ku-ragura
: (a person to sell a thing or to bring tax) gu-toza
: (back woman to her husband when she's gone home) gu-curira
: (workers, some to one place, some to another) gu-tanya
: (one who speaks with s. repetition of words) iki-rogorogo
: (shake down to s. from dirt) gu-kebanya
: (down, to carry and set down frequently) gu-segenyeza
: (time: to do something at a set time) gu-henga
: (one who is great, severe, wise) aka-randa
: (one's head in anger or disgust) ku-zunguza umutwe
: (to buy a thing together and then divide it) gu-sorora
: (tiny, of bean or other plant) umu-goreko
: (new shoots of grass, fresh pasture) umu-gutu
: (to be short something) gu-siba, gu-kererwa, ku-bura
: (the way to one who is lost) ku-zimurura
: (to be often) ku-rwaragurika, ku-bungn (i.e. indwara irambungamwo)
: (to assist s. person in walking) kw-andaza
: (to be taken s. suddenly, supposedly from python looking at one) gu-kangwa
: (to take care of the s.) ku-rwaza
: (on this side of river, valley) hakuno
: (on the other s. of something but this side of river or valley) hirya
: (on the other s. of river, valley) hakurya
: (to lay a thing on its s.) gu-hengeka
: (to turn right side up) gu-curura, kw-uburura
: (one's opponent by speaking the truth) ku-jegeza
: (to be, but not exactly the same) gu-hakwa
: (to do two things at once) ku-bangikanya
: (one banana, head of grain, etc.) umu-hanyu
: (of man's sister or woman's brother) mwishwa
: (to s. fidgeting, or to go from place to place to s. because others speak evil of you) ku-yugayuga
: (together talking for a long time) gu-turika
: (to fix up nice place to s.) gu-sezera
: (worn by king or great chief) iny-ambarabami
: (to fall and s. oneself) gu-kungagura, gu-kunguka
: (to stretch out to dry by pegging) ku-bamba
: (to have something penetrate the s.) gu-seserwa
: (to be s. by a blow) ku-ramuka
: (a superior unintentionally, but he believes it intentional) ku-rengwa
: (to say a lot of slanderous talk) ku-vovota
: (to jump in one's s.) gu-hahamuka, ku-randamuka
: (to be so s. one falls over and stays there) gu-furama
: (down on spear, meat; if it slips it's supposedly diseased) gu-shoka
: (out little by little, e.g. nail) kw-idohora
: (to have s. sides like soup dish) gu-fukura
: (to put on nice smelling stuff) kw-osa
: (manifest pleasure, but not necessarily show teeth) ku-mwemwamwemwa
: (out of an argument or obligation) kw-idohora
: (to get in nose and cause to s., as pepper) gu-sagara
: (to put to s., esp. grain) kw-inika
: (and springy, e.g. earth in swamp) ku-demwademwa
: (esp. in search of place to build) gu-sembera
: -mwe (with plural prefix) e.g. bamwe-bamwe, or, bamwe
: (speaking evil of another with whom you work) i-keba
: (one who speaks with senseless repetition of words) iki-rogorogo
: (distinctly, not having been able to before) gu-tumbura
: (many words, usually quite meaningless ones) gu-hogomboka
: (where others hear voices but do not understand) gu-hwirima
: (to leave off speaking evil and speak kindly) kw-igarura
: (give gift to bride so she will speak) gu-horora
: (refuse to speak till given gift, bride) gu-hororwa
: (spears on big reeds and grasses) umu-sokoro
: (to fall on s. and be injured) gu-shoka
: (defect, esp. for s, ch, c) ubureve, e.g. kuvuga ubureve
: (to be freed from s. impediment) ku-gobodoka
: (to try to give s. but feel restrained) gu-haga amatama
: (to be, in defeat, surprise, misfortune) kw-umirwa
: (to be with shame or fear) gu-teterwa
: (to be with surprise or defeat) ku-jorerwa, ku-jumarara
: (to chase away or drive out evil s.) gu-senda
: (spurted from between teeth as indication of scorn) iny-eri
: (splashing of water on rocks in river) igi-sebuzi
: (to be split open as flesh when wounded) ku-gaguka
: (girls put on clothing to help them get a husband) in-dome
: (and soft, to be as earth in swamp) ku-demwademwa
: ("medicine" around house to protect it from evil) gu-tota
: (to have one stand up) gu-hagarika, gu-hagurutsa
: (to get left behind as you stare at something) ku-rangara
: (job before finishing the previous one) ku-bangikanya
: (to give a s. cry) gu-tura ubuku
: (to not stay in place) ku-juragira, gu-cambagirana
: (one who does not stay home) igi-humbu
: (place where steps are cut in hillside) ubu-kiru
: (to s. out, as garment with something under it) ku-dundura
: (to be from drying up, clothes, food) gu-tetera
: (quarrel and make them like each other) kw-unga
: (a thing because someone has repeatedly warned and advised) gu-kondoka
: (something put away for future use) in-tegakiba
: (to be for several years) gu-hitikirana, gu-hitirana
: (my s. has left me) amagara yandyarutse
: (out skin to dry by pegging) ku-bamba
: (against in order to knock down) gu-sita
: (prepare oneself to, grasp in preparation to) ku-bangura
: (about as if one had nothing else to do) ku-bagabaga
: (to s. about when one should be working) ku-raramanga
: (something which appears to be s. but is weak) igi-hombe
: (to be) gu-hangama, gu-komera, ku-rema, ku-rama, ku-nonoka
: (to seek help to bring into s. to) ku-gomorera
: (to be) ku-ganduka, ku-ganda izosi, gu-kenguruka, ku-gororokera
: (enforce what one has said, to drive it home) ku-ryoherereza
: (one who takes place of guilty man) im-pongano
: (to eat by sucking only, as candy) ku-yongobeza, ku-yungubiza
: (red sun when very low at night) igi-hendabaja
: (one who surpasses all others) aga-hebuza, aga-kura
: (thing that surpasses everything of its kind) aka-minuza, aka-renzo
: (to s.) ku-renga, ku-rusha, ku-rushiriza, ku-ruta, gu-sumba
: (all others, good or bad) gu-hebuza, ku-nengesera
: (to give too much to s. at one time) ku-ramagiza
: (to reverse in a word, transpose) gu-fudika
